page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT IN MITCHELDEAN
page.content: The main employer in the Mitcheldean area is Rank Xerox who make office machinery. Rank began in Mitcheldean after the Second World War, when they took over the old brewery buildings. The plant soon grew until it came to dominate the small town, taking up nearly half the built up area. Of the machines manufactured, some are sold and the remainder are rented. The majority of sales are to EEC countries. In 1975 the workforce was over 4500, but by 1980 had dropped to 3800. By the end of 1985 it is expected to have further diminished to around 1200. Despite this, future prospects could be good, as the company is expanding its range of products to include the new technology.
